lead_paragraph: Three doctors writing in The New England Journal of Medicine have urged a new public policy to allow physician-assisted suicides and have listed a number of guidelines they saytheir colleagues should follow. The article comes as the subject of doctor-assisted suicide has been thrust into the national spotlight largely through the actions of Dr. Jack Kevorkian, the retired pathologist who has helped several severely ill people kill themselves in the Detroit area in the last two and a half years.
